alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 24 at 9:01PM ChST until May 25 at 7:45AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tiyan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Guam... * Until 745 AM ChST Thursday. * At 901 PM ChST, Infrared satellite indicated very heavy rain continuing over Guam. Automated rain gauges show rainfall in excess of 1 to 2 inches over the last hour. Several inches of rain have already fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches per hour with locally heavier rainfall rates. Additional rainfall amounts of 8 to 10 inches are possible, with locally 15+ inches possible. Flash flooding is ongoing. Considerable flash flooding is likely, even for locations that do not normally flood. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Satellite estimates. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * All of Guam. FLASH FLOOD...SATELLITE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
